line_1: Unus'd from studious thought to shrink;
Whose strut majestic made him shrink,
And to a level with the vales would shrink;
line_2: Their stately heads the ancient mountains sink,

line_1: View the pale regions of the dead, and shrink;
line_2: Stretch their fair necks, and leaning o'er the brink

line_1: Each to her oak the bashful Dryads shrink,
line_2: And azure eyes are seen through every chink.

line_1: And when I bend, retire and shrink,
line_2: Says, well — 'tis more than one would think —

line_1: While from his lips the refluent waters shrink;
line_2: So bends tormented TANTALUS to drink,

line_1: MY soul! and dost thou faintly shrink,
line_2: Thus trembling on an awful brink?
